page.title: 12FARMS IN OUR SQUARE
page.content:
Paudy Rise Farm is farmed by Mr. Crook and son. They own 350 acres, but farm 600 acres. They rented it from 1922 but started to buy it in 1959. They work 8 hours a day, seven days a week, but at busy times like harvesttime, 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. They grow wheat, barley, oats, winter wheat and grass. They own 10 tractors, 1 Combine Harvester, a seed drill, plough and harrow. They find the plough most useful. They own 30 suckler cows and 100 head of cattle - Fresian and Hereford and 1 Angus bull. They use Melton and Leicester Markets for beef animals. They exported 80 tons of barley to Poland. Many farmers in the area sent 100 tons of wheat to the people suffering in the Ethiopian famine.
